item.title: 戴尔为马斯克的孟菲斯超级计算机部署数万颗人工智能芯片
item.description: 戴尔科技公司已经部署了数万个图形处理单元，为埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）在孟菲斯的超级计算机项目的人工智能工作提供动力。【原文：Dell Technologies Inc. has deployed tens of thousands of graphics processing units to power artificial intelligence work at Elon Musk’s supercomputer project in Memphis.】

item.title: Invesco称高等级债券利差可能进一步收窄
item.description: Invesco 高级投资组合经理兼北美投资级信用主管 Matt Brill 表示，美国投资级公司债券利差已经接近历史上的紧缩水平，还有进一步收窄的空间。【原文：US investment-grade corporate bond spreads, already near historically tight levels, have room to narrow further, said Invesco Senior Portfolio Manager and Head of North America Investment Grade Credit Matt Brill.】

item.title: OpenAI 新增每月 200 美元的 ChatGPT 专业版订阅模式
item.description: OpenAI 正在为其聊天机器人 ChatGPT 推出一个价格更高的付费层级，其中包括无限制地访问其最强大的人工智能模型，包括可以执行类似人类推理任务的改进版软件。【原文：OpenAI is introducing a higher-priced paid tier for its chatbot ChatGPT that includes unlimited access to its most powerful artificial intelligence models, including an improved version of its software that can perform human-like reasoning tasks.】

item.title: 英国央行格林警告抵押贷款利率对经济增长的拖累将持续存在
item.description: 英格兰银行利率制定者梅根-格林（Megan Greene）警告说，英国消费者支出的恢复尚需时日，因为许多抵押贷款持有人将被高昂的借贷成本所困。【原文：Bank of England rate-setter Megan Greene warned that it will take time for UK consumer spending to recover, as many mortgage holders will be stuck with high borrowing costs.】

item.title: 意大利财政部官员确认 2024 年经济放缓
item.description: 据一位财政部官员称，意大利今年的经济增长可能远低于预期。【原文：Italy’s economy probably grew much less than forecast this year, according to a Finance Ministry official.】

item.title: 巴拿马指望经济软着陆挽救投资级评级
item.description: 巴拿马财政部长正在努力实现经济软着陆，以逐步减少该国的预算赤字，并希望避免失去其梦寐以求的投资级信用评级。【原文：Panama’s finance chief is working to pull off an economic soft landing that would gradually reduce the country’s budget deficit and hopefully avoid the loss of its coveted investment grade credit rating.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行通过稳定利率实验打破全球宽松周期
item.description: 澳大利亚央行正在进行一项大胆的货币试验，即什么都不做。【原文：Australia’s central bank is conducting a bold monetary experiment — by doing nothing.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"准备执行更长期的维护油价任务
item.description: 欧佩克+"承认，其捍卫油价的任务将比预期拖得更久。【原文：OPEC+ is accepting that its mission to defend oil prices will drag on much longer than expected.】

item.title: 利比亚石油日产量创 11 年新高，凸显石油产量反弹趋势
item.description: 利比亚的石油日产量已升至十多年来的最高水平，而就在几个月前，一场政治危机曾削减了该国的石油产量。【原文：Libya’s oil production has risen to the highest daily level in more than a decade, just months after a political crisis slashed the country’s output.】

item.title: 美国国会参议院中国问题小组主席抨击美国芯片禁令存在华为 "漏洞
item.description: 一位重要的众议院共和党人批评拜登政府遏制中国芯片制造野心的最新尝试，称周一公布的美国规则存在漏洞，会让华为技术有限公司（Huawei Technologies Co.【原文：A key House Republican criticized the Biden administration’s latest attempt to curtail China’s chipmaking ambitions, saying US rules unveiled Monday leave loopholes that will let Chinese companies like Huawei Technologies Co. continue acquiring American technology.】

item.title: 私募股权投资从 iCapital 信贷部手中夺回筹资桂冠
item.description: iCapital 首席执行官劳伦斯-卡尔卡诺（Lawrence Calcano）表示，投资者今年首次青睐私募股权投资而非私募信贷。【原文：Investors are favoring private equity over private credit for the first time this year, according to Lawrence Calcano, the chief executive officer of iCapital.】

item.title: 麦肯锡支付 1.22 亿美元解决南非行贿案
item.description: 麦肯锡公司同意支付超过 1.22 亿美元，以解决与南非港口和铁路运营商 Transnet SOC Ltd 前领导人腐败丑闻有关的刑事指控。【原文：McKinsey & Co. has agreed to pay more than $122 million to resolve criminal allegations tied to a corruption scandal involving former leaders of South Africa’s ports and rail operator Transnet SOC Ltd.】

item.title: 欧洲央行寻求加快重大风险转移的审批速度
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧洲央行正在寻求加快对重大风险转移的审批程序，以帮助贷款机构利用对此类交易的旺盛需求。【原文：The European Central Bank is seeking to accelerate its approval process for significant risk transfers, according to people familiar with the matter, helping lenders to take advantage of booming demand for the deals.】

item.title: 商业团体表示，南非需要停止借口并解决增长问题
item.description: 南非当地的一个商业团体表示，南非需要停止为其表现不佳的经济寻找借口，而应研究其根本原因。【原文：South Africa needs to stop finding excuses for its underperforming economy and examine the root causes, a local commerce group said.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚新任财政部长称左翼分子忽视宏观稳定就会失败
item.description: 哥伦比亚新任财政部长表示，如果不能确保宏观经济的稳定，拉丁美洲的进步政府注定会失败。【原文：Progressive governments in Latin America are doomed to fail unless they ensure macroeconomic stability, according to Colombia’s new finance minister.】

item.title: Incora 法官对争吵不休的债权人规定圣诞节最后期限
item.description: 航空航天供应商 Incora 将在圣诞节前知道它是否能在主要债权人之间多年的争吵后摆脱破产，一名法官在为该公司设定新的重组期限时说。【原文：Aerospace supplier Incora will know by Christmas whether it can exit bankruptcy after years of acrimony among its top creditors, a judge said in setting a new reorganization deadline for the company.】

item.title: 阿根廷能源公司出售美债，米莱吸引投资者
item.description: 投资者对哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）总统的财政改革持乐观态度，因此阿根廷的能源公司纷纷涌入公共债务市场。【原文：Argentina’s energy companies are storming public debt markets to capitalize on investors’ optimism over President Javier Milei’s fiscal reforms.】

item.title: 丹麦在有史以来最大的海上风电招标中未收到投标书
item.description: 丹麦在其有史以来规模最大的风力发电招标中没有收到任何投标，该招标旨在到本十年末将其海上发电能力增加两倍以上。【原文：Denmark received no bids in its largest-ever wind power tender, aimed to more than triple its offshore capacity by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 俄罗斯取消通过受制裁银行支付天然气费用的要求
item.description: 弗拉基米尔-普京总统取消了通过俄罗斯天然气工业银行（Gazprombank）支付俄罗斯天然气费用的要求，缓解了人们对美国对该银行实施制裁将导致提前停止供应天然气的担忧。【原文：President Vladimir Putin lifted a requirement to pay for Russian natural gas via Gazprombank, easing concerns that US sanctions imposed on the bank would lead to an early halt of supplies.】

item.title: 英特尔与 Microchip 首席执行官、前 ASML 首席执行官共同组建董事会
item.description: 陷入困境的芯片制造商英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）正在寻找新的首席执行官，该公司在董事会中增加了两位半导体行业的资深人士，并称此举将带来 "经验和运营活力"。【原文：Intel Corp., the embattled chipmaker seeking a new chief executive officer, added two semiconductor industry veterans to its board in a move the company said would bring “experience and operational vigor.”】

item.title: 美国共和党参议员恩斯特拒绝支持黑格塞斯，使饱受争议的被提名人陷入困境
item.description: 参议院共和党人乔妮-恩斯特（Joni Ernst）是一名退伍军人和强奸案幸存者，在军事问题上对共和党同事很有影响力，她明确拒绝支持皮特-黑格塞斯（Pete Hegseth）备受争议的国防部长提名，呼吁进一步调查对他的指控。【原文：Senate Republican Joni Ernst, a combat veteran and rape survivor influential with GOP colleagues on military matters, pointedly declined to support Pete Hegseth’s embattled defense secretary nomination, calling for further investigation of allegations against him.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司和 Ecopetrol 希望将哥伦比亚的天然气储量增加两倍
item.description: 哥伦比亚国家石油公司（Petrobras）和 Ecopetrol SA 发现了哥伦比亚最大的海上天然气储量，如果该储量在商业上可行，将使该国的天然气储量增加两倍，从而有可能缓解该国的天然气短缺问题。【原文：Colombia’s biggest offshore natural gas discovery by Petrobras and Ecopetrol SA could triple the country’s reserves if the deposit is commercially viable, potentially easing the nation’s shortfall.】

item.title: 肯尼亚再次降息，通胀率已达目标
item.description: 肯尼亚中央银行连续第三次下调基准利率，通货膨胀率仍保持在目标范围内。【原文：Kenya’s central bank cut its benchmark interest rate for the third time in a row with inflation remaining within target.】

item.title: 报告称中国关税将使加拿大收入小幅增长
item.description: 加拿大国会预算官员伊夫-吉鲁（Yves Giroux）在周四的一份报告中说，加拿大预计每年可从对中国钢铁、铝和电动汽车征收的新关税中获得约1亿加元（约合7140万美元）的收入。【原文：Canada can expect to collect about C$100 million ($71.4 million) annually from its new tariffs on Chinese steel, aluminum and electric vehicles, Parliamentary Budget Officer Yves Giroux said in a report Thursday.】

item.title: 以色列将在 2024 年通过网络和人工智能交易创下科技并购纪录
item.description: 根据 Vintage Investment Partners 的数据，以色列科技初创企业今年的并购额有望创下历史新高，因为加沙和黎巴嫩的战争并没有影响投资者的胃口。【原文：Israeli technology startups are on track for a record year of mergers and acquisitions, according to Vintage Investment Partners, as wars in Gaza and Lebanon didn’t dent investor appetite.】

item.title: 世界排名第二的锂矿开采商智利寻求新型开采方法
item.description: 智利是拥有最丰富卤水矿藏的锂生产国，在电池金属价格低迷挤压该行业的情况下，智利仍在寻求拓展新的开采类型，包括从粘土中开采。【原文：Chile, the lithium producer with the richest brine deposits, is looking to expand into new types of extraction including from clay, even as low battery-metal prices squeeze the industry.】

item.title: 波兰央行受能源价格影响推迟降息预期
item.description: 据波兰中央银行称，波兰政府决定在明年 9 月之前只降低能源价格，这使通胀前景 "复杂化"，并有效推迟了降息时间。【原文：The Polish government’s decision to reduce energy prices only until next September has “complicated” the outlook for inflation and effectively delayed the timing of interest rate cuts, according to the central bank.】
